job_title: Supplemental Instructor in San Diego, CA

job_title: Therapeutic Foster Care Case Manager in Rochester, NY
pros: Flexible schedule, work is meaningful.
cons: Leadership is stuck in the 80's mindset of needing to work in-office 5 days a week. Absolutely NO diversity.  "We put people first" is anything but what they stand for! Do not care about their employees, $ is bottom line. Was laid off unexpectedly in the most unprofessional manner possible.

pros: Support provided Good staff to child ratio

pros: Great job to have, decent pay, flexible hours.

review_title: Great for the community, hard on staff
job_title: Senior Youth Service Provider in Rochester, NY
pros: Meaningful relations with families, making a difference, flexible schedule

job_title: Speech Therapist in East Corning, NY
pros: Health care, vision and dental were not bad.
cons: Cut position without notice then want you to fill in positions until current position is open again. Had to take a drastic pay cut.

review_title: It's All About the Bottom Dollar for Pathways - NOT the People!
pros: Some of my co-workers were decent & you could tell that they actually cared about the well-being of others.
cons:
I worked for Pathways for almost 4 years with a strong desire to help people. Their motto is, "We Put People First." Sadly, while I worked with them, they actually put money before the people. For example, in my department we were required to meet with families in their homes a certain number of times each month in order to be able to bill for full services. If circumstances arose with the family or even weather became a factor, we were reprimanded for not meeting our quote & losing money for the company! They would prefer that we drove out in the middle of a snow storm to get that last monthly meeting in, than to risk not getting all of they money they could for that month!

DO NOT WORK FOR PATHWAYS - IT'S NOT WORTH IT! They treat their employees poorly & you are not valued. The burnout rate is VERY high for a reason!

pros:
Decent pay
Kids can be fun
Lots of learning
Opportunities to move up because people are always quitting or getting fired
cons:
Bad training
Bad management 
Shady business practices
Overtime

pros: Company work schedule is flexible allowing for parents to work around work schedule as well as juggle family.

cons: Too little pay, too many responsibilities,

pros: Supportive administration, personalized communication and accessibility
cons: supervisors come and go and work revolves around billing which takes the person centered service model and puts it on the back burner

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Corning, NY
pros: Fairly supportive work environment, particularly from peers.
cons: Low pay for experience level

pros:
Kids in the program were excellent, had great imaginations. Some are a handful, but then again, all kids are at some point. 
Split Shift - I enjoyed the split shift that my job required, it allowed me to exercise in the middle of the day, and get other things done.
cons:
Coworkers - while some are cordial, cheerful and helpful, the ones who are the the opposite make the job horrible. As I was in a supervisory role, the workers who were there prior to my hiring were disrespectful and did not come to me for minor disputes.
Pay Rate - Massively underpaid for the type and amount of work required.
Deadlines - Did not have enough time to provide quality plans and activities for the youth in the program. Was forced to slap together things each week, and even then the plans weren't followed by the workers.

job_title: Postdoctoral Clinical Fellow in Rolla, MO
pros: Work with supportive colleagues and have a WIDE variety of diagnostic situations to work with. Also, the integrated treatment team is a great setup.
cons: There are some hierarchy issues in that it's hard to know who to go to with questions or concerns at times. There's also drama related to company needs versus clinical needs but I don't think they are any worse than other community mental health clinics.

pros:
You get to interact with a few good kids and enhance their experience of KAC. 

I considered the split shift as a pro - I could go home and do some chores in between the morning and afternoon.
cons:
Vastly underpaid for the amount of work you do.

Not anywhere enough time to get any decent activities planned out, so we recycled the same activities again and again.

Sites are very clique-y, and communication between workers is sub-par at best.

Workers don't seem to enjoy being in the program at all. Stress is very high.

review_title: Good people doing good things for the community.
pros:
You can make your own schedule.
Family atmosphere.
Management is easy to talk to.
You can have fun while working.
cons:
There is a lot of driving between the clients homes and wherever you want to take them.
You are given very little direction to work with.

review_title: PATHways at Raytheon is a great place to work for corporate health and wellness.
pros: Great managment, good benefits, excellent employees, laid back enviornment, work life balance is encouraged, family is priority, healthy outlook
cons: Small company, limited advancement, behind the technology curve, not enough forward thinking.
